_schema-version.description: The schema version that is being used for authoring a descriptor. The schema version should comply with the semantic versioning standard.

ID.description: An application ID, that may contain any number of unicode characters and should be unique in the target runtime environment.

description.description: A free text describing this application.

version.description: The application version that should comply with the semantic versioning standard.

provider.description: The provider or vendor of this application.

copyright.description: A copyright statement from the provider.

name.description: The MTA module name which must be unique and cannot be the same as any provided property set or resource name.

type.description: The module type that defines the design-time tools for the module.

description.description: A free text describing this module.

path.description: The path to a folder that contains the module artifacts.

deployed-after.description: A list of modules that must be deployed before deploying the current module.

properties.description: A collection of key-value pairs that are available to the module at runtime.

properties-metadata.description: Additional information about the module's properties.

parameters.description: Configuration parameters that are used when deploying the module to the target runtime environment.

parameters-metadata.description: Additional information about the module's parameters.

hooks.description: A list of hooks that will be executed for the module.

build-parameters.description: The build parameters define how the module is built by the corresponding tool.

includes.description: It is possible to define parameters in external files. The "includes" section is used to point to those files.

name.description: The name of an "includes" section. This name is used by a builder to generate a parameter section in the deployment descriptor.

path.description: A path pointing to a file that contains a map of parameters, either in JSON or in YAML format.

provides.description: Used to define the named property sets that other modules and resources can require.

name.description: The name of the property set that the module provides. The provided name must be unique and cannot be the same as any resource or module name.

public.description: Configures the accessibility of the provided property set; if set to "true", it is publically accessible and can be consumed by other MTA projects.

properties.description: A list of properties that are included in this property set.

properties-metadata.description: Additional information about the provided set's properties.

requires.description: A list of property sets provided by other modules and/or resources (providers) that this module requires.

name.description: The name of a provided property set or resource (provider) that this module requires.

group.description: A "group" can be used to combine properties from multiple providers into one runtime lookup object, such as an environment variable. As of schema version 2.1, this property is DEPRECATED.

list.description: Defines a name for a runtime lookup object, such as an environment variable, if the required property set contains multiple values; for example, if used to consume configuration data from outside this MTA project.

properties.description: Module properties whose values are determined by the provided properties. These properties can be referenced by the tilde notation: "~{<provided-property-name>}"

properties-metadata.description: Additional information about the modules's properties.

parameters-metadata.description: Additional information about the modules's parameters.
